subject: [PATCH v2] mm: move pgscan and pgsteal to node stats

reviews.author: Vlastimil (SUSE)
reviews.summary: Reviewer noted that PGREFILL is the only counter not updated to be per-node, suggesting it should also be changed for consistency.
reviews.raw_body:
Hm so that leaves PGREFILL (scanned in the active list) the odd one out,
right? Not being per-node and gated on !cgroup_reclaim() for global stats.
Should we change it too for full consistency?

reviews.author: JP (Meta) (author)
reviews.summary: Author agreed to add counters for the active list side and suggested including PGDEACTIVATE for completeness.
reviews.raw_body:
I'm fine with adding coverage for the active list side as well. For
completeness, I could also include PGDEACTIVATE.

reviews.author: JP (Meta) (author)
reviews.summary: Author acknowledged a concern about the patch affecting global counters accumulation, agreed to restructure in v2 by excluding PGDEACTIVATE from the change and promising to send a new version (v3) that includes PGREFILL.
reviews.raw_body:
Actually, I see PGDEACTIVATE is not gated so I'll leave that one out.
I'll send v3 and include PGREFILL.

2026-02-18.patch_summary: This patch moves the pgscan and pgsteal counters from global vm_event_item to node_stat_item, allowing for per-node reclaim visibility in /proc/zoneinfo. The counters are still visible in /proc/vmstat but now aggregated across all nodes. Memcg accounting is preserved, and the virtio_balloon driver is updated to use the new global_node_page_state() function to fetch the counters.
